string-array.name: configuration_item_descriptions
string-array.item: Current user preference for the scaling factor for fonts, relative to the base density scaling.
IMSI MCC (Mobile Country Code). 0 if undefined.
IMSI MNC (Mobile Network Code). 0 if undefined.
Current user preference for the locale.

Bit mask of overall layout of the screen. Currently there are two fields:\nThe {android.content.res.Configuration.SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_MASK} bits define the overall size of the screen. They may be one of {android.content.res.Configuration.SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_SMALL}, {android.content.res.Configuration.SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_NORMAL}, or {android.content.res.Configuration.SCREENLAYOUT_SIZE_LARGE}.\nThe {android.content.res.Configuration.SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_MASK} defines whether the screen is wider/taller than normal. They may be one of {android.content.res.Configuration.SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_NO} or {android.content.res.Configuration.SCREENLAYOUT_LONG_YES}.

The kind of touch screen attached to the device. One of: {android.content.res.Configuration.TOUCHSCREEN_NOTOUCH}, {android.content.res.Configuration.TOUCHSCREEN_STYLUS}, {android.content.res.Configuration.TOUCHSCREEN_FINGER}.

The kind of keyboard attached to the device. One of: {android.content.res.Configuration.KEYBOARD_NOKEYS}, {android.content.res.Configuration.KEYBOARD_QWERTY}, {android.content.res.Configuration.KEYBOARD_12KEY}.

A flag indicating whether any keyboard is available. Unlike {android.content.res.Configuration.hardKeyboardHidden}, this also takes into account a soft keyboard, so if the hard keyboard is hidden but there is soft keyboard available, it will be set to NO. Value is one of: {android.content.res.Configuration.KEYBOARDHIDDEN_NO}, {android.content.res.Configuration.KEYBOARDHIDDEN_YES}.

A flag indicating whether the hard keyboard has been hidden. This will be set on a device with a mechanism to hide the keyboard from the user, when that mechanism is closed. One of: {android.content.res.Configuration.HARDKEYBOARDHIDDEN_NO}, {android.content.res.Configuration.HARDKEYBOARDHIDDEN_YES}.

The kind of navigation method available on the device. One of: {android.content.res.Configuration.NAVIGATION_NONAV}, {android.content.res.Configuration.NAVIGATION_DPAD}, {android.content.res.Configuration.NAVIGATION_TRACKBALL}, {android.content.res.Configuration.NAVIGATION_WHEEL}.

A flag indicating whether any 5-way or DPAD navigation available. This will be set on a device with a mechanism to hide the navigation controls from the user, when that mechanism is closed. One of: {android.content.res.Configuration.NAVIGATIONHIDDEN_NO}, {android.content.res.Configuration.NAVIGATIONHIDDEN_YES}.

Overall orientation of the screen. May be one of {android.content.res.Configuration.ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE}, {android.content.res.Configuration.ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT}, or {android.content.res.Configuration.ORIENTATION_SQUARE}.

Bit mask of the ui mode. Currently there are two fields:\nThe {android.content.res.Configuration.UI_MODE_TYPE_MASK} bits define the overall ui mode of the device. They may be one of {android.content.res.Configuration.UI_MODE_TYPE_UNDEFINED}, {android.content.res.Configuration.UI_MODE_TYPE_NORMAL}, {android.content.res.Configuration.UI_MODE_TYPE_DESK}, or {android.content.res.Configuration.UI_MODE_TYPE_CAR}.\nThe {android.content.res.Configuration.UI_MODE_NIGHT_MASK} defines whether the screen is in a special mode. They may be one of {android.content.res.Configuration.UI_MODE_NIGHT_UNDEFINED}, {android.content.res.Configuration.UI_MODE_NIGHT_NO} or {android.content.res.Configuration.UI_MODE_NIGHT_YES}.
